Posts.Content: coryjm wrote: Right now, I have only found a lump which is most likely nothing but I have hardly told anyone because I don't want to needlessly worry friends and family but I feel very alone in this also.  Who have you told prior to finding out what the lump was?  I know if I knew that the lump was nothing than I wouldn't care or if it was something then I would tell people for support but right now I am in such limbo that I don't know what to do.  I also have this "nagging" feeling that this lump is something but I'm afraid to say it out loud to anyone; have any of you had a feeling that it was something and it turned out to be nothing?  I would love any advice that you could offer. Not sure if it is a rib growth or a breast lump.  They are so confused and so am I am.  I also have been having chest wall pain...have any of you had that?  The lump and my breast don't hurt but the chest wall hurt and it has for months.

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2010 09:17AM coryjm wrote: Thanks--I did have an ultrasound and the doctor felt the lump, pointed the wand below the lump and said it was my rib and told me to leave.  I was completely dumbfounded by it.  My ob/gyn never heard of this so that is why she refered me to a breast surgeon as soon as she saw the report.
